He had been investing in cryptocurrency for three years but had not made any money. Their social media business dried up and he had about $40,000 worth of debts he couldn't repay. Colleen Rebelo was found dead in the shower at her Bicton home on May 25, 2020. Her son took out three life insurance policies in her name and made himself the sole beneficiary.

The affected coins were released as part of special souvenir sets that were not intended for circulation.

The problem has expanded to Australia, New Zealand, and many other regions worldwide. GTIG identified a North Korean IT worker operating under at least 12 fabricated identities across Europe and the U.S. in late 2024. This individual successfully sought employment within defence industrial bases and European government entities. Since October 2024, DPRK IT workers have increasingly resorted to extortion.

The application of withholding tax on crypto transactions ensures tax collection at the source, mitigating potential evasion.
